Container.Name: monocker
Container.Overview:
Monitors Docker (MONitors dOCKER) containers and alerts on 'state' change.
# Optional server name for alerts SERVER_LABEL: 'Prod' # Optional avatar image URL to add to messages. Handy if you are running Monocker on different machines # -> ONLY supported by discord, slack & ntfy SERVER_AVATAR: 'https://content.invisioncic.com/u329766/monthly_2024_05/monocker.png.ba5ffdb390b627097d2a53645cf87350.png'
# Specify the messaging platform and details, or leave blank if only wanting container logs (pick one only) MESSAGE_PLATFORM: 'telegram@your_bot_id@your_chat_id' # MESSAGE_PLATFORM: 'gotify@app_token' # MESSAGE_PLATFORM: 'pushbullet@your_api_key@your_device_id' # MESSAGE_PLATFORM: 'pushover@your_user_key@your_app_api_token' # MESSAGE_PLATFORM: 'discord@webhook_url' # MESSAGE_PLATFORM: 'ntfy@topic_title' # MESSAGE_PLATFORM: 'slack@bot_user_oauth_token@your_chat_id' # MESSAGE_PLATFORM: ''
# Optional - includes or excludes specified containers - default behaviour is false LABEL_ENABLE: 'false'
# Optional - only show when container state changes to being offline (paused, exited, running (unhealthy), or dead) - default is false ONLY_OFFLINE_STATES: 'false'
# - Regardless of any other settings, you can ignore or include 'exited'. (So it won't alert if you manually stop a container) EXCLUDE_EXITED: 'false'
# - Set the poll period in seconds. Defaults to 10 seconds, which is also the minimum. PERIOD: 10
# - Supress startup messages from being sent. Default is false DISABLE_STARTUP_MSG: 'false'
# - adds SHA ID for all container references. 'true' or 'false' (default) SHA: 'false'
## ADVANCED NTFY SETTINGS #CUSTOM_NTFY_SERVER: 'https://custom.ntfy.com' # use your own NTFY server #NTFY_USER: 'user' # use a username and password to login (on ntfy.sh or your own server. Option if you have your own server open) #NTFY_PASS: 'password'

Config.Name: Docker
Config.Description: Allows Monocker to access the list of running containers on Unraid. (Do not change or remove this!)

Config.Name: Server label
Config.Description: [Optional] Allows you to add a server-specific label to alert messages. Handy if you have multiple servers running Docker.

Config.Name: Server Avatar
Config.Description: Optional avatar image URL to add to messages. Handy if you are running Monocker on different machines (ONLY supported by discord, slack & ntfy)

Config.Name: [Optional] Docker socket address
Config.Description: [Optional] - Set this value to a docker socket URL, if you want to connect to docker this way. Leave it blank or omit it otherwise. e.g tcp://n.n.n.n:2375

Config.Name: Message platform
Config.Description: The details for connecting to a specific message platform.

Config.Name: Only offline states
Config.Description: [Optional] Only monitor container state changing to being offline. (Paused, Exited, Running (unhealth), or Dead). Default is false.

Config.Name: Exclude exited
Config.Description: [Optional] Regardless of any other settings, you can choose to ignore or include container states moving to 'Exited'. (This will optionally show or ignore manual stops or containers).

Config.Name: Period
Config.Description: [Optional] - Set the poll period in seconds. Defaults to 10 seconds, which is also the minimum.

Config.Name: Disable startup messages
Config.Description: [Optional] Suppress startup messages being sent when Monocker starts up

Config.Name: SHA
Config.Description: [optional] - adds SHA ID for all container alerts. 'true' or 'false' (default)

Config.Description: Use this if you self-host a NTFY server. e.g. https://ntfy.yourdomain.com
